p: The secondary metabolites existing in the plants have a role in the treatment of various diseases. 63 In the previous study, the extract of B. abyssinica contains phytoconstituents including, phenols, tannins, alkaloids, triterpene, flavonoids, anthraquinones, steroids, polysterols, coumarins, and glycosides. 16 Flavonoids, tannin, and an alkaloid were some of the renowned compounds that were isolated from the extracts that are capable of reducing the elevated BGL. 64â€“ 66 Therefore, the significant anti-diabetic and anti-hyperlipidemic activity of the solvent fractions of B. abyssinica could be because of the attendance of the aforementioned secondary metabolites in the plant.
